column1: Table D1.18.4: Remoteness by personal stressors experienced in last 12 months, Indigenous Australians aged 15 and over 2014–15(a)
Death of a family member or close friend
Not able to get a job
You/family member/close friend spent time in jail
Treated badly because you are Aboriginal/Torres Strait Islander
Total population with one or more stressors
Total number of persons 15 years and over
* Represents statistically significant differences at the p < 0.05 level. Statistical testing compares the percentages in 'Total remote' to the percentages in the reference group 'Total non-remote'.
† Per cent has a relative standard error between 25% and 50% and should be used with caution.
‡ Per cent has a relative standard error greater than 50% and is considered too unreliable for general use.
(b) Proportions have been calculated on the total number of Indigenous persons aged 15 and over, not the total population with one or more stressors.
(d) Multiple responses allowed. Components will not add to total. Percentages are of those who experienced one or more stressors.
Note: Percentages add within columns. Estimates have been rounded and discrepancies may occur between sums of the component items and totals.
Source:  AIHW and ABS analysis of National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Social Survey 2014–15.
